result.execSummary:
The defendant Kelliann Meg Matteson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: to Family Video in Wausau. At a rate of no less than $50/month. First payment to be made Decemember 2015.
GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT Schooling or a combination thereof. Or any time she does not meet that requirement, defendant is to perform 10 hours community service per week.
No contact with Family Video Schofield or Wausau.

Any assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.
Probation may be transferred to Lafayette Co.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

15CM1617 - Ct. 1 (Theft/PTAC)>>GUILTY

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  

COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/held on both counts; 1 year probation on each count, concurrent.
CONDITIONS: Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; N/C w/Family Video in Schofield or Family Video in Wausau; Restitution of $189.96 to Family Video in Schofield at the rate of no less than $50/month, J&S, and first payment to be made in December 2015; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof, or any time she does not meet that requirement, defendant to perform 10 hours of community service per week; CC.

>>If defendant pays restitution in full and successfully completes probation, she may petition the COURT for expungement of both files.
